groups.name: CodeMods
groups.comments: These are automated code modifications to update codebase to new standards or libraries. More are available at app.codemods.dev. These can be run as npx codemod react/19/replace-string-ref or npx codemod react/19/replace-string-ref --target (to target a specific file/path).

groups.name: CodeMods
groups.comments: These are automated code modifications to update codebase to new standards or libraries. More are available at app.codemods.dev. These can be run as npx codemod react/19/replace-string-ref or npx codemod react/19/replace-string-ref --target (to target a specific file/path).

sections.name: Accessibility (WCAG)
sections.comments: ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, focus management, screen reader compatibility, color contrast, semantic HTML

sections.name: API Integration & Data Fetching
sections.comments: React Query/SWR patterns, error handling, caching strategies, request deduplication, optimistic updates, polling/refetching

sections.name: Authentication & Authorization
sections.comments: Auth patterns, token management, protected routes, role-based access, session handling, OAuth flows

sections.name: Browser Compatibility
sections.comments: Cross-browser testing, polyfills, feature detection, graceful degradation, vendor prefixes

sections.name: Build & Deployment
sections.comments: Build optimization, CI/CD pipelines, environment management, deployment strategies, rollback procedures

sections.name: Checklist
sections.comments: Detailed items to review for web applications.

sections.name: Code Cleanup & Quality
sections.comments: Code quality checks including deprecated functions, anti-patterns, and type safety

sections.name: Component Best Practices
sections.comments: React component best practices including display names and React 19 features

sections.name: Comprehensive Code Review
sections.comments: General code review tasks to ensure code quality and adherence to best practices.

sections.name: Configuration Reviews
sections.comments: Review configuration files including .gitignore, ESLint, tsconfig, etc.

sections.name: CSS/Styling Architecture
sections.comments: CSS modules, styled-components, Tailwind patterns, theme management, responsive design, CSS-in-JS performance

sections.name: Dependency Management
sections.comments: Vulnerability scanning, update strategies, breaking change reviews, license compliance, dependency size impact

sections.name: Developer Experience
sections.comments: Hot module replacement, dev tools, debugging setup, code generation, local development environment

sections.name: Documentation and Consistency
sections.comments: Documentation reviews and consistency checks across the codebase

sections.name: Error Handling & Logging
sections.comments: Error boundaries, error tracking (Sentry, LogRocket), user-friendly error messages, fallback UI, logging strategy

sections.name: Forms & Validation
sections.comments: Form libraries (React Hook Form, Formik), validation patterns, error messaging, accessibility in forms, controlled vs uncontrolled inputs

sections.name: Internationalization (i18n)
sections.comments: Translation management, locale handling, RTL support, date/number formatting, pluralization

sections.name: Monitoring & Analytics
sections.comments: Performance monitoring, user analytics, error tracking, A/B testing, feature flags

sections.name: Performance Measurements
sections.comments: Measurements.

sections.name: Performance Optimization
sections.comments: Performance optimization including bundle size, rendering, and CLS measurements

sections.name: React 19 Upgrade
sections.comments: Steps to upgrade the codebase to React 19. (Note: Upgrade to 19.2 is another set.)

sections.name: React Router Upgrade
sections.comments: Steps to upgrade the codebase to React Router 6.

sections.name: Security
sections.comments: Security audits including hardcoded secrets and WAF configuration

sections.name: SEO & Meta Tags
sections.comments: OpenGraph tags, structured data, meta descriptions, canonical URLs, sitemap, robots.txt

sections.name: State Management
sections.comments: Redux/Zustand/Context patterns, state normalization, selector optimization, state persistence, avoiding unnecessary re-renders

sections.name: Testing
sections.comments: Testing for responsive design, accessibility, and color schemes

sections.name: Testing Strategy
sections.comments: Unit tests (Vitest), integration tests, E2E tests (Playwright/Cypress), test coverage targets, mocking strategies

code.content:
<geolocation onlocation="handleLocation(event)" accuracymode="precise">
  <!-- Fallback content for browsers that do not support the element -->
  <button onclick="navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(handleLocation)">
    Use my location
  </button>
</geolocation>

items.name: Geolocation Tag
items.comments: Chrome 144 (Jan 2026) introduces the <geolocation> HTML tag for requesting user location with enhanced privacy controls.
